topic.title: Zame - a game showcasing the ZeroFrame Godot Engine addon capabilities
topic.body:
https://github.com/lentsius-bark/zame-zeroframe-godot - Considering the addon for Godot is pretty near its completion we went ahead and started making a game, a game, a... game.... a Zame! (getit?)
It will be a map editor and a simple platformer at the same time. Where one can make/edit a level, save it and if desired upload it onto ZeroNet.
Of course one can also check for uploaded maps on ZeroNet and download any that are found.

topic.title: GGJ 2019 [Global Game Jam]
topic.body:
Anyone participating this year? An x-post from gamedevelopment.bit
http://127.0.0.1:43110/gamedevelopment.bit/?Topic:1548252464_1Jn2r5AhDMYjYmfrxqKjRspzHpDYcWsAWX/GGJ+2019+Global+Game+Jam

4_1EMpuiFM1NLZmAVyoAWnwi8VwiZVV4dcnN.body: Anyone here? I have a question!

1542317704_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
Having the leaderboards up on here, and also making them accessible for viewing through a zite with a comments section will have the potential of driving quite the number of people to ZN.
Really looking forward to it.
That's not all! Once the leaderboards are up, adding more such as user profiles, game related info, mini games, event information, rewards, marketplace for in game items. Basically a really tight link. So many possibilities there. If it worked well I'd even tell my players to check out ZN for extra free content.

This will also lead to other developers seeing the potential as I've talked to a few about the idea and although they were inclined to liking it they weren't interested as they hadn't seen it work yet. There are hurdles, I'm sure, on this course, however pretty certain there's a way though.

1547325276_1Jn2r5AhDMYjYmfrxqKjRspzHpDYc.body: Forgot to mention - it's still a WIP.

> [eightyfour](#comment_54_191jbK3GNmVritcMymKkFuxyYFXxqv2xpC): Really nice! Will the game be a browser game, or do I have to download it?

This hasn't been decided yet though if the add-on permits it HTML5 won't be a problem and we'll definitely make that available. Should it work we'll also make it live here on ZeroNet.

> [styromaniac](#comment_430_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The other option is Python, correct?

We're making the game in GodotEngine, which uses its own scripting language called GDScript.

> [robione](#comment_156_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): This is a great collaborative work by two guys. Can't wait to try it..

Thanks! Working hard on getting it done and sent to the community ASAP ;)

1547571350_191jbK3GNmVritcMymKkFuxyYFXxq.body: I'd love to go though I don't think it'll work out. Be sure to spread the word about ZeroFrame at GodotCON ;)

1553607490_1NYxK9cC899pvxFuCt6eE53APoueD.body: I feel ZeroNet is about to get a whole lotta more popular with no extra marketing.
